alert.note: Alert for Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:34AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central New Hanover and east central Brunswick Counties through 615 AM EDT... At 534 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Silver Lake, or near Snows Cut, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Carolina Beach, Wrightsville Beach, South Masonboro Island, Snows Cut, North Masonboro Island, Figure Eight Island, Myrtle Grove, Silver Lake, Sea Breeze, Masonboro, Landfall, Seagate, University Of North Carolina At Wilmington, New Hanover Regional Medical Center, and Cape Fear Hospital. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover
